definition: to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
alone/independent/single/sole/only
variant of 霸[ba4]
hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter
surname Fang

sentences.english: Regional newspapers cultivated cosy monopolies and routinely enjoyed annual profit margins of more than 20%.
sentences.chinese: 地方报纸独霸一方，独享每年超过20%的盈利。

definition: to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
to oppress/to rule as a despot/to tyrannize
local tyrant
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
lit. to hide the sky with one hand/to hide the truth from the masses
to set up an independent regime/to secede/segmentation/division/fragmentation
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
big boss/leader of a group/dominant (position)
to inspire awe
to inspire awe throughout the empire (idiom)
to unify/unified
lit. to rebuke Heaven and Earth (idiom); fig. shaking the whole world/all-powerful
to be in a position of power
to go on the rampage/to riot/to run amuck
power/(ability to) influence
to be on an equal footing
